event.title: Cycles
event.name: CPU Cycles
event.description: The counter increments on every cycle.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Increment PMSWINC Register
event.description: The counter increments on writes to the PMSWINC register.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts instruction memory accesses that cause a refill of at least the Level 1 instruction or unified cache. This includes each instruction memory access that causes a refill from outside the cache. It excludes accesses that do not cause a new cache refill but are satisfied from refilling data of a previous miss.

event.title: L1 Instruction TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts instruction memory accesses that cause a TLB refill of at least the Level 1 instruction TLB. This includes each instruction memory access that causes an access to a level of memory system due to a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts each memory-read operation or memory-write operation that causes a refill of at least the Level 1 data or unified cache from outside the Level 1 cache. Each access that causes a new linefill is counted, including those from instructions that generate multiple accesses, such as load or store multiples, and PUSH and POP instructions. In particular, the counter counts accesses to the Level 1 cache that cause a refill that is satisfied by another Level 1 data or unified cache, or a Level 2 cache, or memory.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts each memory-read operation or memory-write operation that causes a cache access to at least the Level 1 data or unified cache. Each access to a cache line is counted including the multiple accesses of instructions, such as LDM or STM . Each access to other Level 1 data or unified memory structures, for example refill buffers, write buffers, and write- back buffers, is also counted.

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts each memory-read operation or memory-write operation that causes a TLB refill of at least the Level 1 data or unified TLB. It counts each read or write that causes a refill, in the form of a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Load
event.description: The counter increments for every executed memory-reading instruction.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Store
event.description: The counter increments for every executed memory-writing instruction, including SWP. The counter does not increment for a Store-Exclusive instruction that fails.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: All
event.description: The counter increments for every architecturally executed instruction.

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Taken
event.description: The counter increments for each exception taken. The counter counts only the processor exceptions. It does not count untrapped floating-point exceptions or ThumbEE null checks and index checks.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Exception Returns
event.description: The counter increments for each executed exception return instruction.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to CONTEXTIDR
event.description: The counter increments for every write to the CONTEXTIDR.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to PC
event.description: The counter increments for every software change of the PC. This includes all: Branch instructions, memory reading instructions that explicitly write to the PC, Data processing instructions that explicitly write to the PC, and Exception return instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Immediate)
event.description: The counter counts all immediate branch instructions that are architecturally executed.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Return)
event.description: The counter counts all procedure return instructions that are architecturally executed.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Unaligned Load/Store
event.description: The counter counts each memory-reading instruction or memory-writing instruction that accesses an unaligned address.

event.title: Branch Predictor
event.name: Mispredictions
event.description: The counter counts each correction to the predicted program flow that occurs because of a misprediction from, or no prediction from, the branch prediction resources and that relates to instructions that the branch prediction resources are capable of predicting.

event.title: Branch Predictor
event.name: Possible Predictions
event.description: The counter counts every branch or other change in the program flow that the branch prediction resources are capable of predicting.

event.title: Cache
event.name: Write buffer full
event.description: Any write buffer full cycle

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 store
event.description: Any store that is merged in the L2 memory system

event.title: Cache
event.name: Bufferable transaction
event.description: Any bufferable store transaction from load/store to L2 cache, excluding eviction or cast out data

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 access
event.description: Any accesses to the L2 cache

event.title: Cache
event.name: L2 miss
event.description: Any cacheable miss in the L2 cache

event.title: AXI
event.name: Read
event.description: The number of AXI read data transfers

event.title: AXI
event.name: Write
event.description: The number of AXI write data transfers

event.title: Memory
event.name: Replay event
event.description: Any replay event in the memory system

event.title: Memory
event.name: Unaligned access replay
event.description: Any unaligned memory access that results in a replay

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1 data hash miss
event.description: Any L1 data memory access that misses in the cache as a result of the hashing algorithm. The cases covered are: hash hit and physical address miss, hash hit and physical address hit in another way and hash miss and physical address hit.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1 inst hash miss
event.description: Any L1 instruction memory access that misses in the cache as a result of the hashing algorithm. The cases covered are: hash hit and physical address miss, hash hit and physical address hit in another way and hash miss and physical address hit.

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1 page coloring
event.description: Any L1 data memory access in which a page coloring alias occurs. alias = virtual address [12] ! = physical address [12]. This behavior results in a data memory eviction or cast out.

event.title: NEON
event.name: L1 cache hit
event.description: Any NEON access that hits in the L1 data cache

event.title: NEON
event.name: L1 cache access
event.description: Any NEON cacheable data accesses for L1 data cache

event.title: NEON
event.name: L2 cache access
event.description: Any L2 cache accesses as a result of a NEON memory access

event.title: NEON
event.name: L2 cache hit
event.description: Any NEON hit in the L2 cache

event.title: Cache
event.name: L1 inst access
event.description: Any L1 instruction cache access, excluding CP15 cache accesses

event.title: Branch
event.name: Return stack misprediction
event.description: Any return stack misprediction because of incorrect target address for a taken return stack pop

event.title: Branch
event.name: Direction misprediction
event.description: Two forms of branch direction misprediction: branch predicted taken, but was not taken and branch predicted not taken, but was taken

event.title: Branch
event.name: Taken prediction
event.description: Any predictable branch that is predicted to be taken

event.title: Branch
event.name: Executed and taken prediction
event.description: Any predictable branch that is executed and taken

event.title: Core
event.name: Operations issued
event.description: Number of operations issued, where an operation is either: an instruction or one operation in a sequence of operations that make up a multi-cycle instruction

event.title: Core
event.name: No issue cycles
event.description: Increment for every cycle that no instructions are available for issue

event.title: Core
event.name: Issue cycles
event.description: For every cycle, this event counts the number of instructions issued in that cycle. Multi-cycle instructions are only counted once.

event.title: NEON
event.name: MRC data wait
event.description: Number of cycles the processor stalls waiting on MRC data from NEON

event.title: NEON
event.name: Full queue
event.description: Number of cycles that the processor stalls as a result of a full NEON instruction queue or NEON load queue

event.title: NEON
event.name: Idle
event.description: Number of cycles that NEON and integer processors are both not idle

event.title: External
event.name: PMUEXTIN[0]
event.description: Counts any event from external input source PMUEXTIN[0]

event.title: External
event.name: PMUEXTIN[1]
event.description: Counts any event from external input source PMUEXTIN[1]

event.title: External
event.name: PMUEXTIN[0,1]
event.description: Counts any event from both external input sources PMUEXTIN[0] and PMUEXTIN[1]
